page.description: Deletes the current record in the 'primary' table. Applies only to a component that has been bound to one or more tables.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Optional. A JSON object with one or more of the following properties:

item.name: nextRecordToShow
item.description: if blank, then the next record in the keylist is shown. if 'newrecord', the new record is shown

item.name: confirmation
item.description: true/false - controls if the confirmation dialog is shown

item.name: serverSideCanDeleteFunction
item.description: name of the Xbasic function to call before the delete is executed

item.name: serverSideAfterDeleteFunction
item.description: name of the Xbasic function to call after the delete is executed

discussion.p: Applies only to a component that has been bound to one or more tables. Deletes the current record in the 'primary' table. (If the component is bound to a single table, the 'primary' table is the table to which the component is bound. However, if the component is bound to multiple (linked) tables, the 'primary' table is the top-most parent table of the linked tables.)

section.note: *[IMPORTANT]* This action can only be used if you have loaded primary keys for the primary table. You can load primary keys using the 'Get Primary Keys for Parent Table' server-side action in the onDialogInitialize event, or in an Ajax callback, using the 'Get Primary Key values for Records in a Query' action in Action Javascript.

description.p: After the record is deleted, focus will move to the next record in the primary key list that has been loaded.
A confirmation dialog will be displayed before the callback is made.
